d365SolutionArchitect.note: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Consultant / Solution Architect persona
d365SolutionArchitect.pitch: Perfect fit for D365: Deep ERP implementation experience (ERPNext, Ariba), 10 years finance understanding ERP from user perspective (P2P, O2C, S2C, R2R, finance modules), 10 years IT building systems. I bridge business requirements and technical implementation. Led multi-site ERP projects. Change management expert. Understand finance, supply chain, and procurement modules intimately because I've USED them as a controller.
relevantExperience: ERP Implementation: Multiple ERPNext implementations for SMEs from requirements to go-live
P2P Processes: Deep expertise from Ariba implementation and procurement finance roles
O2C Processes: Experience from finance roles managing order to cash
S2C Processes: Source to Contract expertise from procurement finance
R2R Processes: Record to Report from leading outsourcing RFPs
Finance Modules: 10 years as controller - I KNOW what finance users need from ERP
Supply Chain Modules: Supply Chain Controller role - understand manufacturing, planning, inventory
Procurement Modules: Indirect Procurement Finance - know vendor management, PO, invoicing
Requirements Analysis: Led requirements for Spend BI tool covering 6M invoices
Solution Architecture: Designed complete IT/BI systems from scratch
Multi-site Implementations: Managed 3 plants, implemented systems across multiple states/countries
Change Management: 80% of my work is education - ensuring user adoption and success
Data Migration: Experience with ETL, data warehousing, data quality
Integration: Built systems that integrate finance, procurement, and supply chain data
Business Process Optimization: Target costing tools, P2P optimization, process reengineering
d365SolutionArchitect.uniqueValue: Unlike typical D365 consultants who are either technical OR functional, I'm both. I can configure the system (technical background) AND I deeply understand business processes because I've RUN them (controller for 10 years). I speak the language of CFOs, Supply Chain VPs, and Procurement Directors because I've been in their shoes. Plus, educator at heart - ensure adoption, not just implementation.

d365Modules.financeAndOperations: My sweet spot. 10 years controlling $250M+ P&L. Deep understanding of GL, AP, AR, Fixed Assets, Cost Accounting, Budgeting, Financial Reporting. Led strategic CAPEX, make-or-buy decisions, financial modeling.
d365Modules.supplyChainManagement: Supply Chain Controller for 25% of European supply (3 plants, 160k tons). Understand production planning, inventory management, warehouse management, quality management, manufacturing.
d365Modules.procurement: Indirect Procurement Finance expert. Understand vendor management, purchase requisitions, POs, RFQs, contracts, invoice processing, payment terms, working capital optimization.
d365Modules.projectOperations: IPMA Level C certified. Led USD 200M projects. Understand project-based businesses, resource management, project accounting, time and expense.

d365SolutionArchitect.implementationApproach: I don't just implement D365 - I ensure business value. Start with business process understanding (not jumping to config). Map current state, identify pain points, design future state. Heavy emphasis on change management and training (my 80% education approach). Measure success by user adoption and business outcomes, not just go-live.

interests: Architecture (watches every episode of Grand Designs - if I knew about architecture discipline, would have chosen it as profession)

personalityAndValues.coreStrength: I bridge worlds. Technology and business. Engineering and finance. Strategy and implementation. Data and decisions. Technical and non-technical. This is my superpower.
personalityAndValues.educatorAtHeart: 80% of my work is teaching: explaining FOSS benefits, training users, helping them discover tips and tricks. Finance taught me storytelling with numbers. I empower through knowledge, not create dependency.
personalityAndValues.procurementPassion: Procurement and supply chain runs in my blood. I've been the finance partner (driving cash and savings), the consultant (implementing systems), and the founder (building solutions). I understand it from every angle.
personalityAndValues.customerSuccess: Love seeing customers succeed. Technology products excite me. I don't just promise - I deliver the message of value with purpose and integrity. Get my hands dirty helping customers adapt technology to fit their needs.
personalityAndValues.continuousLearner: Believe in continually updating myself. MBA while working. Predictive Data Science in 2019. Learning German for Swiss market. With experience comes benefit of having made mistakes - always learning.
personalityAndValues.resilience: 'If life gives you lemons, make lemonade' - my mentor's wisdom. COVID crashed my bootstrapped startup dream. Not defeated, just a bit wiser. Back in job market ready to contribute.
personalityAndValues.foss: FOSS evangelist. Believe small businesses deserve enterprise-grade technology without vendor lock-in. Democratize technology access. Open source is about freedom and empowerment.
personalityAndValues.uniqueCombination: Most consultants come from either business OR technology. I come from both. 10 years learning to speak 'business' in finance roles, then 10 years learning to speak 'technology' in IT. Now I translate between the two. Add in IPMA Level C project management and passion for education, and you have someone who can not only implement solutions but ensure they're understood, adopted, and successful.

archilogic.interest: Digitization of real estate is like digitizing the brain of an architect. Beautiful, complex, and sometimes surprising. Archilogic is onto something very special.
archilogic.passion: If I knew what the discipline of architecture was back then, I would have chosen it as my profession. I chose what was available to me (Electronics Engineering). Today, I look at Archilogic with a big smile and wish to apply.
archilogic.fit: Couldn't have imagined that one day, I could combine my talent stack (IT and Finance) with my passion for architecture. I think I have watched every episode of Grand Designs.

givaudan.connection: Know Givaudan from a long time as you were/are one of the top tiered suppliers for Unilever in Fragrances and Flavors (fine chemicals).
givaudan.passion: As a foodie myself, I am amazed how a company can figure out the fine process of taste and smell.
givaudan.relevance: Procurement and Supply Chain runs in my blood. Experience in Finance and project management will benefit in coordination & politics of project/process management, P2P and S2C processes, driving cash and savings.

siemens.attraction: Siemens is not a new company to me. I have always aspired to work with engineering companies as my core is that of an engineer.

siemens.fit: Data is in my blood. Having built data warehouses as a data architect and then owning business specification at Unilever has given me experience of democratizing data even before the term was probably invented. Plus 10 year stint in Indirect Procurement Finance, SG&A controlling and supply chain controlling puts me in the heart as a 'data consumer'.

openSystems.philosophy: A great Product Marketing Manager should not just promise, but also deliver the message of value with purpose and integrity. Technology products excite me.
